title: Collaboration Structure Comparison Study
assumption: Static role allocation is optimal for human-AI research collaboration
hypothesis: Dynamic role allocation outperforms static allocation by 20% on quality metrics
evaluationPlan: Within-subject experiment with 30 participants across 3 conditions (static-AI-lead, static-human-lead, dynamic). Measure quality via expert ratings, efficiency via time-to-completion, cognitive load via NASA-TLX.
implications: If confirmed, redesign AI assistants to support fluid role transitions
relatedWork: Bansal et al. 2019, Amershi et al. 2019
milestones: Week 1: Setup, Week 2-5: Data collection, Week 6: Analysis
successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement (p<0.05) with medium effect size (eta-squared>0.06)

title: Knowledge Accumulation Longitudinal Study
assumption: Session context does not significantly impact collaboration quality
hypothesis: Accumulated context leads to 30% faster task completion by session 5 compared to fresh-context baseline
evaluationPlan: Longitudinal study with 20 participants over 5 sessions. Compare accumulated vs fresh context conditions using mixed-effects models.
implications: Justifies building persistent memory systems into AI research tools
milestones: Week 1: Recruitment, Weeks 2-4: Sessions, Week 5: Analysis
successCriteria: Significant session x condition interaction in mixed-effects model
